content.text:
Who was the patron of the building? <image 1> <image 2>

A. Abd al-Malik
B. Justinian
C. Charlemagne
D. Shah Jahan

The images provided depict the Hagia Sophia, a famous architectural marvel located in Istanbul, Turkey. The Hagia Sophia was originally built as a Christian basilica and later converted into a mosque. It is renowned for its massive dome and intricate mosaics.

The patron of the Hagia Sophia was Emperor Justinian I of the Byzantine Empire. He commissioned the construction of the Hagia Sophia in the 6th century AD, specifically between 532 and 537 AD. The architects responsible for its design were Anthemius of Tralles and Isidore of Miletus.

Given this information, the correct answer is:

B. Justinian
Now, output the final answer and nothing else:
